newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean economy grows 7.6 pct January-to-July.
newsitem.headline: Chilean economy grows 7.6 pct January-to-July.

text.p: The Chilean economy grew 7.6 percent in the first seven months of the year over the same period of 1995, the Central Bank said in its monthly macroeconomic report.
The figure was slightly below most expectations. It followed the Central Bank's earlier announcement of 5.8 percent growth in July, which was well below expectations.
Referring to the seven-month figure, the Central Bank said that "although it signals dynamism in the economy, it stands at levels in line with the rate of growth expected for the whole year."
A modest reduction in growth in the mining sector was partly responsible for the low July figure, said the report.

Although growth in the first few months of the year was surpassing eight percent, it levelled off starting in the second quarter and is now forecast by the Central Bank to end the year at about seven percent.
